Others: The Kansas City Royals lost first baseman Vinnie Pasquantino to a broken thumb during their game against the Houston Astros on August 29, 2024.
Pasquantino is expected to miss the rest of the regular season and potentially the entire playoff run due to the injury.
Pasquantino was hitting.262 with 19 home runs and 97 RBI before the injury.
The Royals will need to rely more on Salvador Perez and Bobby Witt Jr. in Pasquantino's absence.
It's unknown how the Royals will handle Pasquantino's absence defensively.
The Royals are currently 75-60 on the season and are 1.5 games behind the Cleveland Guardians in the American League Central.
The Royals are holding onto the second wild card spot in the American League, but this injury could have a significant impact on their playoff run.
